channel.title: aleksati.net / music tech and creative computing
channel.description: Part portfolio and part music technology blog. I write about audio programming, networked music, creative computing, software development, and more.

image.title: aleksati.net / music tech and creative computing

item.title: aleks.max - A Bundle of Max Abstractions for Audio, Video and Data Processing
item.description: aleks.max is my tiny library of self-contained Max code snippets. It's a continuous effort to clean up and publish some of my Max abstractions I believe can be useful to others.

item.title: Exploring Dataset Sonification with Web Audio
item.description: Thanks to modern browsers and open-source coding libraries, creating audio-visual art on the Web is easier than ever. In this post, I share some examples of how to enrich data visualizations with model-based sonification in a browser using the p5js library.

item.title: 0101101000 ... (Hello World)
item.description: A sound-sculpture made of burned drywall paper tape, methyl cellulose, aluminum flashing, bluetooth transducers, concrete and steel rods. The sculpture generates sound and vibrations based on the wifi traffic on-site. Made in collaboration with Henrik Nordahl.

item.title: Using Python to Control Ableton Live With MIDI
item.description: While designing a new liveset, I wrote some mapping code to help me navigate Ableton Live's UI more efficiently using very few midi controls. Here is what I did, and how.

item.title: 5G Networked Music Performances - Will It Work?
item.description: My collegue and I teamed up with Telenor Research to see if it's possible to play music together over next generation 5G networks. Here are the preliminary results from our first audio experiments on 5G.

item.title: Karwowski, Kann & Tidemann + Nordahl
item.description: An improvisational audio-visual quartet that offers thought-provoking and immersive concert experiences, combining guitar, vocals, live electronics, and projected visual art.

item.title: AudioVideoAnalysis - A Standalone Tool for Realtime Analysis of Spectral Audio and Video
item.description: A quick look into AudioVideoAnalysis (v2.0); a standalone application for real-time OpenGL rendering of video motiongrams and audio spectrograms, developed in collaboration with FourMS Lab at the RITMO research center, University of Oslo.

item.title: VideoAnalysis - A Standalone Tool for Analyzing Music-related Body Motion
item.description: A quick look into VideoAnalysis (v2.1); a beginners tool for analyzing music-related body motion, developed in collaboration with FourMS Lab at the RITMO research centre, University of Oslo.

item.title: Radio 9
item.description: A krautrock electronic pop trio from Oslo that takes you on a sonic journey from subtle electronic atmospheres to jarring post-punk whiteouts.

item.title: The Holy Mountain
item.description: A groundbreaking avant-garde pop trio that blends accordion, synthesizer, drums, and vocals to create hypnotic compositions.
